title: JavaScript Basics Quiz
description: Test your understanding of JavaScript fundamentals including variables, functions, and data types.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a constant variable in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'const' keyword is used to declare constants in JavaScript. Variables declared with 'const' cannot be reassigned after initialization.

questions.question: What will be the output of: console.log(typeof null)?
questions.explanation: This is a known quirk in JavaScript. typeof null returns 'object', which is considered a bug in the language but has been kept for backward compatibility.

questions.question: JavaScript is a statically typed language.
questions.explanation: JavaScript is a dynamically typed language, meaning variable types are determined at runtime and can change during execution.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a primitive data type in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Array is not a primitive data type. It's an object type. The primitive types in JavaScript are: String, Number, Boolean, Undefined, Null, Symbol, and BigInt.

questions.question: What is the correct way to create a function in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, functions are declared using the 'function' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.
